odase.concurrency

Class DependencyQueue

  • java.lang.Object
    • odase.concurrency.DependencyQueue

  • public class DependencyQueue
extends Object
    A dependency-aware but otherwise FIFO queue. The queue arranges all items into a directional graph. (the graph must be acyclic). The set of items with now edges leading to them are popped in fifo order. Edges are removed as tasks are completed, and edges are weakened when tasks are scheduled. This queue is also thread-safe.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DependencyQueue

        public DependencyQueue(int initial_ready_set_size,
                       Logger logger)
        Construct a new empty queue.
        Parameters:
        initial_ready_set_size - is the size that the set of tasks that are ready for execution now is expected to be.

    • Method Detail

      • dequeue

        public AbstractTask dequeue(boolean can_run_startable)
                     throws InterruptedException
        Blocking dequeue mothod. This method will dequeue a task from the head of the queue. If the queue is empty or there are no 'runntable' tasks available then the call will block. Blocking can be interrupted by interrupting the thread.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException

      • offer

        public boolean offer(AbstractTask task)
        Offer a task to the queue. Add the task to the queue, returning false if for some reason the task cannot be added to the queue. This call will not call "wait" meaning that it will not block on the size of the queue. It is sonchronized and may block before entering its critical section.

      • size

        public int size()
